meanings.sent1: She desisted from playing with the noisy toy.
meanings.sent2: The child desisted from running in the house.
meanings.sent3: He desisted from eating the last cookie, fearing a tummy ache.
meanings.sent4: The cat desisted from chasing the squirrel, realizing it was too fast.
meanings.sent5: After the warning, he desisted from touching the hot stove.

meanings.definition: To cease or abstain from something
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised him to desist from eating sugary foods.
meanings.sent2: She desisted from gossiping after realizing its harmful effects.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to desist from laughing at the student's funny mistake.
meanings.sent4: The athlete decided to desist from training for a day to give his body rest.
meanings.sent5: In order to maintain focus, he desisted from checking his phone during study time.
